$interpreted: Feiz: So many days have passed; why haven't you located the bandit leader? At this pace, Fredrica is going to get all the credit!

Jerome: General Feiz, please give me another three days.
I guarantee I'll find him.
Feiz: And if you don't?
Jerome: If I fail, I will take full responsibility and resign.
Feiz: You said that yourself. If things do come down to that, I will hold you to your word!
Forgetful Tom: Officer Muca, why didn't you tell General Feiz that General Lucien was the one who let the bandit leader go?
Jerome: Back then, the bandit leader was right there in front of me. My ineptitude was indeed the reason they got away. I should be held responsible too.
Forgetful Tom: But...
Jerome: Stop dwelling on that. Rather than arguing here about who to blame, we would be much better off if we find those bandits soon.
Forgetful Tom: Never thought that officer Jerome can be so persistent. Even in that situation, he managed to not badmouth his ex-girlfriend even once~
Forgetful Tom: What a loyal and great man~ If was a girl, I would've married him without hesitation~
Scout: Officer Jerome!
Jerome: Have you located those bandits?
Scout: I did indeed find them. However...
Jerome: How dare they try to disguise themselves as gentle farmers. Men, apprehend these bandits!
Jerome: You guys...why didn't you resist at all?
Bandit Leader: We've promised to not be bandits anymore. Even if we got captured by you, w wouldn't resist.
Jerome: ....If you behaved yourself and farmed without causing trouble, you wouldn't have been arrested.

Bandit Leader: To be honest, we were all farmers in the first place. However, when the civil war broke out, all our crops were expropriated.
We had to resort to robbery because we had no other choice.
Jerome: Even if that's the case, you still can't rob other people's stuff.
Bandit Leader: You noble folks will never understand. Can you ever imagine the feeling of a child gradually starving to death in your own hands?
Bandit Leader: In a chaotic world, if you don't rob others, you'll end up being the ones robbed!
Jerome: ......
Forgetful Tom: Officer, are we escorting them to prison now?
Jerome: Let me think about it. What they committed is certainly excusable considering the circumstances...
Jerome: (Could it be that General Lucien knew about their hardships? Is that why she decided to give them another chance?)
Feiz: What is there to hesitate about!

Feiz: They will all be punished according to the law!
They should've had that realization when they decided to break the law.
Jerome: ...General Feiz. They committed their crimes during the civil war. I believe that a sweeping generalization here is not appropriate.
Jerome: During times of war, everyone is a victim. As soldiers, our duty should be to protect the victims!
Feiz: Muca, I don't want to waste time listening to your quibble. If you don't want to carry out the law, then you will be asked to resign immediately!
Feiz: I don't need an officer that will disobey my orders.
Jerome: Understood. Thank you for taking care of me these days.
Forgetful Tom: Officer Muca......
Feiz: If anybody else wants to resign, I will not stop you.
Forgetful Tom: ......
Feiz: Others! On my command, escort these bandits back.
Soldier: General Feiz! Bad news!
Soldier: The civilians of Jersey caught wind of our arrest of these people. They are all protesting! They demand we release these bandits right away.
Feiz: What! How dare they try to shelter the bandits! Apprehend them all!
Jerome: General Feiz, are you going to deploy the army to suppress civilians!?
Feiz: From the moment they decided to rebel, they are no longer civilians. They are now nothing more than a gang of rioters!
Jerome: —— If you are planning to point your blades at unarmed civilians, then please forgive me for my offenses!
Feiz: Quit chasing after him. The urgent matter now is to suppress the rioters!

Model.Text: So many days have passed; why haven't you located the bandit leader? At this pace, Fredrica is going to get all the credit!

General Feiz, please give me another three days.
I guarantee I'll find him.
And if you don't?
If I fail, I will take full responsibility and resign.
You said that yourself. If things do come down to that, I will hold you to your word!
Officer Muca, why didn't you tell General Feiz that General Lucien was the one who let the bandit leader go?
Back then, the bandit leader was right there in front of me. My ineptitude was indeed the reason they got away. I should be held responsible too.
But...
Stop dwelling on that. Rather than arguing here about who to blame, we would be much better off if we find those bandits soon.
Never thought that officer Jerome can be so persistent. Even in that situation, he managed to not badmouth his ex-girlfriend even once~
What a loyal and great man~ If was a girl, I would've married him without hesitation~
Officer Jerome!
Have you located those bandits?
I did indeed find them. However...
How dare they try to disguise themselves as gentle farmers. Men, apprehend these bandits!
You guys...why didn't you resist at all?
We've promised to not be bandits anymore. Even if we got captured by you, w wouldn't resist.
....If you behaved yourself and farmed without causing trouble, you wouldn't have been arrested.

To be honest, we were all farmers in the first place. However, when the civil war broke out, all our crops were expropriated.
We had to resort to robbery because we had no other choice.
Even if that's the case, you still can't rob other people's stuff.
You noble folks will never understand. Can you ever imagine the feeling of a child gradually starving to death in your own hands?
In a chaotic world, if you don't rob others, you'll end up being the ones robbed!
Officer, are we escorting them to prison now?
Let me think about it. What they committed is certainly excusable considering the circumstances...
(Could it be that General Lucien knew about their hardships? Is that why she decided to give them another chance?)
What is there to hesitate about!

They will all be punished according to the law!
They should've had that realization when they decided to break the law.
...General Feiz. They committed their crimes during the civil war. I believe that a sweeping generalization here is not appropriate.

Muca, I don't want to waste time listening to your quibble. If you don't want to carry out the law, then you will be asked to resign immediately!
I don't need an officer that will disobey my orders.
Understood. Thank you for taking care of me these days.
Officer Muca......
If anybody else wants to resign, I will not stop you.
Others! On my command, escort these bandits back.
General Feiz! Bad news!
The civilians of Jersey caught wind of our arrest of these people. They are all protesting! They demand we release these bandits right away.
What! How dare they try to shelter the bandits! Apprehend them all!
General Feiz, are you going to deploy the army to suppress civilians!?
From the moment they decided to rebel, they are no longer civilians. They are now nothing more than a gang of rioters!
—— If you are planning to point your blades at unarmed civilians, then please forgive me for my offenses!
Quit chasing after him. The urgent matter now is to suppress the rioters!
